main event: On 30 June 1949, a civilian observer in Seligman, New Mexico reported a sighting of a single UFO, resembling a dull grey, sharply outlined object, flying at a high speed and disappearing suddenly after 8 seconds of observation.
interesting points: The object appeared to be 1/2 inch in diameter at 10,000 feet altitude when directly overhead.
It traveled at an estimated speed of 3,000 mph or faster, leaving no sound or odor.
The sky was perfectly clear during the observation, and the area was sparsely populated for miles around.
The observer, a well-educated vet meat inspector, had no reported glasses on during the sighting and was viewed viewed with bare eyes which are said to be 20/20.
Following the sighting, reports of similar objects were heard, indicating a potential wave of UFO sightings.
sighted object: Single UFO resembling a dull grey, sharply outlined object
